meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a program.
meanings.sent1: The school's programmatic approach to teaching math ensures all students learn effectively.
meanings.sent2: The company's programmatic advertising strategy targets specific audiences online.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the programmatic robot trying to dance at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her programmatic daily routine was like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The programmatic nature of the ant colony's movements was fascinating to observe.

meanings.definition: Following a planned or organized program.
meanings.sent1: The team's programmatic schedule kept them on track for the project deadline.
meanings.sent2: The programmatic sequence of events in the play captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: It was funny to watch the programmatic penguin waddle in perfect rhythm.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a programmatic series of tasks, each leading to the next.
meanings.sent5: The programmatic flow of the music guided the dancers effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the use of computer programs.
meanings.sent1: The programmatic error in the code caused the software to crash.
meanings.sent2: Programmatic solutions are often more efficient in handling large datasets.
meanings.sent3: It was comical to see the programmatic chatbot struggle to understand emojis.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in a programmatic way, breaking down problems into logical steps.
meanings.sent5: The programmatic design of the website made navigation simple and intuitive.
